p: Figure 5 summarizes the permeability measurement results for the cement samples exposed to a condition similar to one cycle of steam injection at 300 °C for 3 days. These samples firstly cured at 38 °C using the water bath for 4 days ( Figure 5a) and 25 days ( Figure 5b) then exposed to a high-temperature condition of 300 °C for three days using a high-pressure and high-temperature (HPHT) curing chamber, the total curing time periods are 7 ( Figure 5a) and 28 days ( Figure 5b), all cement samples were dried before air permeability measurements as recommended by Sanjuán and Muñoz-Martialay [ 37].
